title.value: SMPL-IK: Learned Morphology-Aware Inverse Kinematics for AI Driven Artistic Workflows
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning and in multiple sections of the provided text.
title.quote: ACM Reference Format: Vikram Voleti, Boris N. Oreshkin, Florent Bocquelet, Félix G. Harvey, Louis- Simon Ménard, and Christopher Pal. 2018. SMPL-IK: Learned Morphology- Aware Inverse Kinematics for AI Driven Artistic Workflows.

extractions.description: The paper introduces a new learned inverse kinematics (IK) model called SMPL-IK, which integrates the SMPL model to offer more flexible and morphology-aware pose editing capabilities. The proposed system allows for AI-driven artistic workflows by enabling pose flexibility with regard to gender and body shape and by supporting custom character integration through a Shape Inversion (SMPL-SI) mechanism.

type.justification: The paper provides quantitative baselines for SMPL-IK using datasets like H36M and AMASS, indicating that it involves empirical research through experiments and evaluations.
type.quote: In addition to qualitative demos showing proposed tools, we present quantitative SMPL-IK baselines on the H36M and AMASS datasets.

name.justification: The research primarily deals with animation and inverse kinematics, which are crucial aspects of computer graphics.
The paper discusses methodologies related to 3D pose editing, character modeling, and animation workflows.
name.quote: SMPL-IK: Learned Morphology-Aware Inverse Kinematics for AI Driven Artistic Workflows

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on developing a learned inverse kinematics model for flexible 3D pose manipulation.
name.quote: Inverse Kinematics (IK) is the problem of estimating 3D positions and rotations of body joints given some end-effector locations.

name.justification: SMPL-IK is introduced as the primary model in the paper for morphology-aware inverse kinematics.
name.quote: We call our model SMPL-IK, and show that when integrated into real- time 3D software, this extended system opens up opportunities for defining novel AI-assisted animation workflows.

is_contributed.justification: SMPL-IK is developed as a contribution of this research to address the limitations of existing IK models when integrated with SMPL.
is_contributed.quote: In our work we close this gap, exploring and solving two inverse problems in the context of the SMPL human mesh representation: SMPL-IK
